de.esoco.lib.json

Class JsonBuilder.ConvertJson

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.esoco.lib.json.JsonBuilder.ConvertJson
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    InvertibleFunction<java.lang.Object,java.lang.String>, java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Object,java.lang.String>
    Enclosing class:
    JsonBuilder

    public static class JsonBuilder.ConvertJson
extends java.lang.Object
implements InvertibleFunction<java.lang.Object,java.lang.String>
    An invertible function to convert objects to (evaluate(Object)) and from (invert(String) JSON. Can be subclassed to extend the base functionality.

    • Method Detail

      • evaluate

        public java.lang.String evaluate(java.lang.Object rValue)
        Evaluates the function on the input value and returns the resulting value. The declaration of this method does not contain a throws clause to make the execution of standard functions as simple as possible. In cases where a function implementation needs to signal a checked exception it should wrap it in an FunctionException which is a subclass of RuntimeException. In such a case the possibility of the occurrence of such exceptions should be documented appropriately in the function documentation.
        Parameters:
        rValue - The input value of the function
        Returns:
        The resulting (output) value (may be NULL)

      • invert

        public java.lang.Object invert(java.lang.String sJson)
        Inverts the evaluation of this function. The returned object must be at least equal to an input value that would yield the argument value as the output of the Function.evaluate(Object) method so that the expression invert(evaluate(I)).equals(I) == true is valid. It is not required but possible to provide an identity relation so that even the expression invert(evaluate(I)) == I is valid.
        Specified by:
        invert in interface InvertibleFunction<java.lang.Object,java.lang.String>
        Parameters:
        sJson - The evaluation output value to invert
        Returns:
        The inverted output value
